articles.headline: Pentagon Chief Orders New Inquiry Into U.S. Airstrike That Killed Dozens in Syria
articles.snippet: The decision follows a New York Times investigation that described allegations that top officials had sought to conceal civilian casualties.
articles.abstract: The decision follows a New York Times investigation that described allegations that top officials had sought to conceal civilian casualties.
articles.lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III on Monday ordered a new high-level investigation into a U.S. airstrike in Syria in 2019 that killed dozens of women and children, the Pentagon said.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Dave Philipps

articles.headline: Who Is Parag Agrawal, Twitter’s New C.E.O.?
articles.snippet: A longtime Twitter insider and a confidant of co-founder Jack Dorsey, Mr. Agrawal takes over as the social media company confronts various challenges.
articles.abstract: A longtime Twitter insider and a confidant of co-founder Jack Dorsey, Mr. Agrawal takes over as the social media company confronts various challenges.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Jack Dorsey, then Twitter’s executive chairman, pushed the company to build out its machine learning and artificial intelligence capabilities in 2014, he turned to an engineer, Parag Agrawal.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac, Kate Conger and Cade Metz

articles.headline: Here We Go Again: Chaos Rules Global Response to Omicron Variant
articles.snippet: Almost two years into the pandemic, finger-pointing, lack of coordination, sparse information and fear are once again influencing policy.
articles.abstract: Almost two years into the pandemic, finger-pointing, lack of coordination, sparse information and fear are once again influencing policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROME — In a wrenchingly familiar cycle of tracking first cases, pointing fingers and banning travel, nations worldwide reacted Monday to the Omicron variant of the coronavirus in the piecemeal fashion that has defined — and hobbled — the pandemic response all along.

articles.headline: Elizabeth Holmes Says Former Boyfriend Abused Her
articles.snippet: Ms. Holmes, the founder of the failed blood testing start-up Theranos, blamed Ramesh Balwani, the former No. 2 at the company.
articles.abstract: Ms. Holmes, the founder of the failed blood testing start-up Theranos, blamed Ramesh Balwani, the former No. 2 at the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — Taking a deep breath, Elizabeth Holmes briefly crumpled her face as she spoke, her voice breaking.
articles.byline: By Erin Woo and Erin Griffith

articles.headline: With Scant Information on Omicron, Biden Turned to Travel Ban to Buy Time
articles.snippet: “Here’s what it does: It gives us time,” President Biden said of the flight restrictions. He called the new variant a cause for concern, not panic.
articles.abstract: “Here’s what it does: It gives us time,” President Biden said of the flight restrictions. He called the new variant a cause for concern, not panic.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — By the time President Biden was briefed on the emergence of a fast-moving new Covid variant on the morning after Thanksgiving, he had a choice to make — and little information to base it on.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Sheryl Stolberg
